definition: to change from good to bad in morals, manners, or actions, bribe
examples: was accused of corrupting the youth

definition: to degrade with unsound principles or moral values
examples: Some fear the merger will corrupt the competitive marketplace.
The fruits were transported without being corrupted.

definition: to subject (a person) to corruption of blood
to alter from the original or correct form or version

examples: leaving the bodies to corrupt on the field

definition: characterized by improper conduct (such as bribery or the selling of favors)
adulterated or debased by change from an original or correct condition
examples: a corrupt version of the text
